visualization_prompt: Generate a pie chart showing the nutrient distribution in egg yolk using selectable segments with percentage annotations
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 5 categorical variables representing nutrient components in egg yolk, with quantitative percentages summing to 100%. Synthetic data follows nutritional science literature values, maintaining domain-appropriate ranges (e.g., water content >50%, ash <2%). The source study from MDPI provides empirical validation for the proportions. A pie chart effectively communicates parts-to-whole relationships, adhering to Tufte's principle by directly encoding values as arc angles. Color differentiation follows Cairo's preattentive processing guidelines, with adjacent hues ensuring discriminability. Selected segments (fat/carbohydrates) emphasize notable micronutrient concentrations. Percentage formatting (μ=20.0%, σ=21.8) highlights water's dominance and micronutrient scarcity through visual weight distribution.
